dialogues.text: Hey! Give it! They’re not Stopit! They need our help! * yours! This is first contact! Can they stay, Mom? Please? The world’s gotta know! Just for a little while? dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: (humbly beseeching) We are a long way from home, Ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: And experience indicates, it’s a bit dangerous out there for Smurfs.

dialogues.speaker: HEFTY
dialogues.text: For once, I agree with Brainy.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: We'll be out of your hair in no time. When the Blue Moon rises, we simply search out the nearest portal and--  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 37.

dialogues.text: I’m sorry, did you say, Blue Moon?

dialogues.text: Well, I hope you’re happy. You were a perfectly respectable hag, yet you wasted my fine blue brew turning yourself into a strumpet!

dialogues.text: Sacré Blu!... Mother?! Gargamel turns, to find Odile gazing in shock at her moth the cosmetologist, newly restored to youth.

dialogues.text: Comment?... Que?... qui?  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 39. Odile’s mother points, wordlessly to Gargamel. As Odile stares at him, Gargamel melts, utterly taken in by the mo beautiful woman he’s ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: ODILE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who are you? How did you do this?

dialogues.text: I... I... well... Obviously, my potion is more amazing than even I expected.

dialogues.text: Can you do it again? She reaches for his empty bottle. Gargamel clutches it.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: (re her mother) W-why would I do that again?

dialogues.speaker: ODILE
dialogues.text: Don’t play coy. Women would kill for a drop of that.

dialogues.text: Women? Shrewdly changing tacks, she draws closer, stroking his c with a perfectly manicured finger. She speaks seductively

dialogues.speaker: ODILE
dialogues.text: Of course, a man as charming as yourself is probably bored silly by the attention of beautiful women.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: (enraptured, dazed) Oh. Yes, it’s so... wearying... always being the object... of desire.

dialogues.speaker: ODILE
dialogues.text: Tout de suite, everyone! Get the man a latte! Caviar! A massage! His any desire! How often are we graced by the presence of such genius? Azrael MEOWS in confusion. Gargamel stomps on his tail, shutting him up, but never turning his gaze from Odile’s.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: (overcome ) I'm sorry... Did you say... genius?  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 40. Odile locks eyes with the strange man before her.

dialogues.text: Come out, come out, little Smurfs. I promise not to hurt you... very much. Realizing he’s being watched, Gargamel SNARLS at the man. Unnerved, the man resumes SUCKING debris from his yard.

dialogues.text: Brainy strikes a chord on Guitar Hero.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: Like this? Sam enters and cranks the volume.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No... more like this.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Dad’s not gonna like you playing his sound system so loud!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Dad's not here, is he? He hits a chord that literally threatens to shatter the windows. Brainy holds onto his ears. The others love it.

dialogues.speaker: GUTSY
dialogues.text: That’s more like it, lad!  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of ROCK MUSIC draws Gargagmel’s eyes up to a wi now silhouetted with rockin’ Smurfs. He smiles and casts look at the man with the leaf vacuum. EXT. WINSLOWS’ ROOF - EVENING - SAME Papa studies the stars with Sam’s telescope, concerned by their positions. Rechecking his calculations, he grows mo concerned, not noticing as the scope drifts down to... CLOSE ON: Gargamel's face as he stuffs the neighbor into trashcan, whacking him with the nozzle of the leaf vac. Back to the scope, Papa GASPS, then charges the window, b bounces off. It’s jammed. He eyes... the chimney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud KNOCK at the door. Sophie enters with Clumsy and Handy. Leaving the security chain on, she cracks the door

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Who is it? Papa bounces out of the fireplace in a POOF of ash.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Don’t open that-- BAM! The door is kicked open. Sophie, Papa and Smurfs go all directions as Gargamel and Azrael step in.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: Heeeeere's Gargy! RRRRRRrrrrrrr! He REVS the leaf vac and sucks up Vanity. GARGAMEL (CONT’D) Deeeeeeeeeeelicious! (LAUGHS, then to Azrael) Make it so, Number One! Azrael GROWLS with delight and charges upstairs. Gargamel vacuums up Clumsy as Sophie sits up.

dialogues.speaker: CLUMSY
dialogues.text: The GUITAR HERO MUSIC stops 0O.S. as Smurfs flee from Azr Crazy erupts in a series of ALARM noises.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 51.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFS
dialogues.text: Azrael! Help! Smurf for your lives! Papaaaaaaaaa! Gargamel starts vacuuming them up, CACKLING with glee. Sa appears at the banister, hurling pool balls. Gargamel excitedly bats them away with the nozzle.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Sophie! Call 911!

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: (ponders the vac, then) Hefty, Brainy, Smurfette -- see if you can lure Azrael under that desk!

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: (cowardly) Actually, Papa Smurf, don’t you need my leadership skills here with-- OOF! Suddenly, Brainy’s shoved under the antigue desk and into a cast-iron ornamental vent cover by Hefty and Smurf

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why do I have to be the bait?

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE
dialogues.text: What, you think that’s a job for a girl? She gives him a final push into the vent. Suddenly... Hef YELLS and gets SUCKED up by the vac. IN THE HALL: Sophie holds the cordless PHONE in one hand scoops fleeing smurfs into her doll stroller with the oth

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (INTO CORDLESS PHONE)
dialogues.text: It’s not a prank, officer! An evil sorcerer-er!... Vacuuming our Smurfs! The phone CLICKS dead. She hurls it at Gargamel and dashe away, scooping more Smurfs to saftey. SMURFETTE pokes out from under the desk and spots Azrael.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE
dialogues.text: (faking distressed damsel) Oh dear! Help! Anybody! Brainy’s trapped and he can’t get out! Azrael grins and comes running as Smurfette slips away.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 52.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaaaaaagh! As Azrael paws insanely for Brainy, safe behind the vent, Papa races into the hall and blows Gargamel a RASPBERRY.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Hey! Smurf-hole! Gargamel gives chase. Papa dives under the desk.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: Come to papa... Papa! Gargamel shoves the vac tube under the desk. MEOOW! The v sticks on Azrael’s butt, SUCKING him in. The motor STRAIN Gargamel withdraws the tube to find Azrael’s tail protrud GARGAMEL (CONT’D) Azrael, No! Speak to me! Speak to me sweetkins! As Gargamel SMACKS the tube about, Sam, Gutsy and Handy h everything they’ve got at him from the bannister.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Get... Out... Of my house!

dialogues.speaker: GUSTY
dialogues.text: We' gotta’ shut tha’ thing doon! He grabs a terrified Handy and leaps...

dialogues.speaker: GUTSY HANDY
dialogues.text: Long live the Smurfs! Ahhhhhhhhh! They land on Gargamel’s back as he flails around trying t free Azrael. Gutsy yanks his hair, while handy studies th blower. Plugged by Azrael, it WAILS with INCREASING PITCH Handy spots a switch... REVERSE. CLICK! The pressure begi to build. Oblivious, Gargamel, continues whacking the tub while trying to get Gutsy off his head.

dialogues.speaker: HANDY
dialogues.text: She’s gonna blow! Handy and Gutsy jump clear as Gargamel bangs the vac one time to free Azrael... WHOOSH! Azrael shoots out as if fr canon. MEEOOOWL! He careens off a lamp, slams into a wall and slides into a heap. Gargamel is simultaneously blown back as Smurfs shoot fro vac like from an automatic T-shirt gun.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 53. Smurfs land everywhere as Gargamel sails, BELLOWING, out door. Sophie SLAMS it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gargamel lays on his back, out cold. The Winslows door op and Azrael is BOOTED into a heap beside his master as the slams closed again. As Azrael licks Gargamel’s face... RING. Van’s phone. Puzzled Gargamel, opens it, and is startled by Odile’s vo

dialogues.speaker: ODILE, (0.S. - ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Gargamel, dahling. Just checking in. How's it coming? The sound of her brings him to life. He stares coldly at house as the Smurfs and children shut windows, pull shade etc. All in a vain attempt to keep him out.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: Fear not, m’lady. I’11l have the ingredients for your potion any minute, now.

dialogues.speaker: ODILE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Fabuleux! I'11 send a car for you at two, tomorrow. Mon chéri, when you take the GlamourCon stage and the spotlights come on, you’ll be a star. Suddenly the spotlights do come on and Gargamel is filled anticipation as... POLICE CARS surround him.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER, (0.S. LOUDSPEAKER)
dialogues.text: Police! Get you hands on your head!

dialogues.speaker: GARDENING ENTHUSIAST
dialogues.text: (charging in with POLICE) That’s him! He’s the one who attacked me!

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: You again! On your knees! (FIRES up blower) All of you! On your knees or feel the wrath of the great and powerful-- ZAPPPP! A police taser takes him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids and Smurfs watch out the window, CHEERING as the police drive off with Gargamel.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 54.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE ROMEO
dialogues.text: Thank Smurf! That's what I’m sayin’. Crazy cranks up Guitar Hero and launches into an victory as the other Smurfs begin a wild dance. Then, the MUSIC STOPS. The Smurfs all turn to a careworn

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: (holding his star notes) Quiet, everyone! Please! I'm afraid things are not quite as smurfy as they seem. The Smurfs nervously gather around Papa.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, my little Smurfs... I’m afraid without my books or laboratory, getting home will be a smurf harder than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: You mean... we can’t get home?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: No no, of course we’ll get home... I just, um, ah, well...

dialogues.speaker: GREEDY
dialogues.text: What about smurfberries? We ate most of ‘em in the chocolate box. A MURMER of panick ripples through the group.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Calm down, my little Smurfs. First things first, we still have a few Smurfberries. Papa pulls a pouch from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS SMURFS
dialogues.text: But that’1ll never last! There’s too many of us! I feel weak already! I I want to go home!

dialogues.speaker: CLUMSY
dialogues.text: Oh, boy, this is all my fault.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Now, now, Clumsy. No need for blame.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 55. The others try not to glare too hard at Clumsy, but clear they’re not happy with him. Sophie picks him up into a hu

dialogues.speaker: PAPA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we can just find an ancient collection of alchemy books, I should be able to Smurf us a way home.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: You mean, magic books?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Maybe something like... this? As Sam quickly types at the Viao, the Smurfs gather aroun amazed by a list of ADS for MAGIC BOOKS.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Amazing. What is this finding machine?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It’s called Google.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFS
dialogues.text: Oooo00h. Gooooooogle.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: (re book title) There! That should work!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ah, “One copy... Master Li’s Antique Magic Pagoda, Chinatown.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: That's it then. First thing in the morning, I’ll ask your father to lead a search party to “Chinese” Town.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Our dad? You're smurfin’ with us, right? He doesn’t have time to tie his own shoes.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: He’s under so much pressure you could use him as an inner tube on a bicycle.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: That may be, but we fathers have a way of speaking to one another. I’m sure when I explain our situation, he’1l understand.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 56.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Oookay. Good good luck with that.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Now, let’s get this place cleaned up. ‘Cause what he won't understand, is you getting our house attacked by ye olde homicidal wizard. Beat. The Smurfs swarm the house, desperately cleaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Gracie pull into the drive. INT HALL/SOPHIE’S ROOM - NIGHT - MOMENTS LATER Patrick & Gracie peer in to find Sophie, Reina and Clumsy asleep, cuddled with several Smurfs in bed. Dozens more S peacefully, cuddled in shoe-box beds all over the room. INT. SAM'S ROOM —- NIGHT - MOMENTS LATER Patrick & Gracie peer in to see Sam sleeping amidst the clutter of his room. Gutsy SNORES in the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I don’t see why we needed that meeting. He’s a really good kid.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: He’s a great kid. He’s just got a lot of energy and needs his father to help direct it. Off Patrick’s look, she lovingly caresses his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick listens to FRENCH lessons on his laptop, while reviewing the Paris file Odile gave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In bed, Gracie soothes baby Reina in the bassinet with on hand, while, browsing discount school clothes on the internet. She types an IM: Going to bed now. Love you. DOWNSTAIRS: Patric replies: luv _u 2. nite. Disappointed, Gracie, closes her lap top and curls up in huge bed, alone.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papers are stamped with a BANG. A filthy, long-nailed thu is imprinted. In a FLASH, Gargamel’s dour MUG SHOT appear MEOW! A caged Azrael WAILS as he and Gargamel’s bag are checked into the property room. A cell door SLAMS and Gargamel is left to rot. He shakes the bars...

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: You can’t do this! I’ma genius! I have to get ready for GlamourCon! They're going to worship me! Worship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick finally closes his computer and enters the kitche put on tea. There, Smurfs cuddle in oven mitts and pot- holders. Cook SNORES, clinging to a ladle. Patrick opens cupboard and Lazy tumbles out. Patrick catches him and nestles him in a bowl. Opening a drawer for a spoon, Patr finds Crazy, BEAT BOXING in his sleep. As Patrick gently closes the drawer, SILENCING the sound. HUSHED VOICES catch his attention.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I know it’s silly Papa Smurf, but when I close my eyes, all I see is Gargamel. As if he’s calling to me. Patrick peers into the breakfast nook. On a seat cushion, Papa tucks in Smurfette. Brainy lies awake, nearby.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: There, there, my little Smurfette. His power over you faded long ago.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: (SHUDDERS with fear) Might we change the subject? These cushions, for instance. Quite lumpy. I miss my mushroom. Vanity chimes in from a Barbie couch in a nearby DOLLHOUS His eyes now covered with a doll-sized sleep mask.

dialogues.speaker: VANITY
dialogues.text: I never slept outside our village. I’m going to wake with worry lines.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Shhh, now, now, my little Smurfs... (SOFTLY SINGING) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 58.

dialogues.speaker: SLEEP MY LITTLE BLUE BIRDS...
dialogues.text: With SONG #3, Papa lullabies the last of his waking Smurf sleep, wishing them safely home. During the song we cut t PRISON: Gargamel twists a VERSE, luring a MOTH to his cel He WHISPERS to it, a la Gandalf, and sends it for “help.” BACK TO WINSLOW’S KITCHEN...By SONG’S END, Patrick is hum by Papa’s tenderness with so many Smurfs.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (whispering) That’s quite an operation you’ve got going there.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, uh... Yes, I suppose it is.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: You don’t do that every night? Patrick pours Papa some tea in a SHOT GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Well, bedtime’s always trickier away from home.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Wow. I’ve only got three mouths to feed and I’m up to my neck.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Well, it helps not to think of them as mouths to feed, but as hands that can help. (off Patrick’s look) Smurf be told... I’m a little over my head myself. In fact, might I be so bold as to seek a small favour of you, Master Winslow? One Papa to another?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (wary) Uh... Like what?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Ah. Well, there’s a book of magic spells in your Chinese Town I need to conjure a blue moon to smurf us home.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 59.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Riiight. Who hasn’t needed that?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Exactly. So if you could arrange passage for us in the morning--

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Oh, wow. Mr. Smurf, I’d love to help with your magical quest, but truth is, I’m stretched so thin right now, I just can’t take on even one more little thing... or a hundred.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: (crestfallen) Oh, I see.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I mean, Gracie wants me home more, the kids need attention, the bills are piling up and now I’m suppose to be in Paris twice a month.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: (masking disappointment) Right, right... of course.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Yeah. And the worse thing? Gracie doesn’t even know about Paris yet... I don’t know how to tell her. It’s gonna break her heart. Papa graciously sets his own worries aside with a SIGH...

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Well... There’s no use keeping secrets, my friend. You’ll just wind up alone.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: So... You think I should just come out and tell her?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: I often find with my little Smurfs, the truth, gently coated with tender care, is easier to hear. Do something meaningful for her. Then share... Then duck.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 60.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (smiles) Something meaningful, huh? Hmmm... Maybe there’s hope for me yet. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: (smiles) Sometimes even a Papa needs a Papa. Patrick pauses in the doorway, struck by some deeper thou

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Right, well... Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Oh, and Master Winslow... You might also take her hand, look her in the eye and say, I smurf you. Does the heart good.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (beat, amused) I‘1l keep it in mind. Patrick Exits. Papa SIGHS, then gazing from the moon, bac his sleeping Smurfs, he quietly REPRISES the LULLABYE...

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Worry no worry. Fret no fret. Soon, I'll dream you home... (then, sadly) If only I knew how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie and Sam actually sit at breakfast as Patrick does best to serve French Toast. He pulls Sam’s earphones out.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Not this morning.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Who are you trying to impress? We’re going to be late for school.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: I’m full dad. I gotta get my books.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Just wait for you mom, would ya? I have something important to tell her.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 61.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sam! Sophie! C’mon, we’re gonna be-- (enters, surprised by kids) Late?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (hands her tea, proudly) Four Winslows at the table. We’re spending time together. REVEAL Reina under the table, happily chewing on Grouchy.

dialogues.speaker: GROUCHY
dialogues.text: I hate spending time together.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: Wow. I could get used to this. (as Patrick beams) French Toast? What is it with you and French lately?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: What? No. It’s just-- that’s all I know how to make. Suddenly, Sam’s helicopter WHIRLS through the kitchen, followed by Gutsy, chasing it with the remote control.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: (casually ducks copter) C’mon on guys, we’ve gotta’ go.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Wait, you’re going in early?

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: Reina’s got her shots so she can start preschool. Then we've got Mommy and Me and we’re going to Carol’s for a playdate. Why?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Nothing. It’s just... I wanted to spend some time with you so we could talk because... you know... (looking for words) I smurf you?  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 62.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: I have no idea what that means... (whispers in his ear) But, I totally smurf you too.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (whispers back) Then, how about dinner, tonight?

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: (dubious) I thought we’re trying to save money.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: We could order in?

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: (a gleam in her eye) Or... I could drop the kids at my sister’s after school and someone could make us a nice romantic meal... Like he used to... when we were young?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (anxiety building) Uhh. Okay. Sure. That’s... great.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: (a playful kiss) You should come home from Europe more often... Kids, let’s move it! As his family piles out, Patrick watches them go, unnerve

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I don’t have time to make dinner. I don’t even remember how to make dinner. Patrick looks down to see Cook, Smurfette and the others looking up at him. Without words an idea is hatched. EXT. WINSLOW HOUSE/INT. GRACIE’S CAR - DAY Gracie loads baby bags into the trunk. Sophie climbs in b with her toy baby buggy and bulging BACKPACK, from which Hefty, Gutsy, and Clumsy peer from half-opened zippers.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Sophie struggles to keep the Smurfs in her pack. Like Wha Mole, one’s head goes in, another’s arm, leg or butt pops  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 63.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: I’m taking them to get Papa’s magic book, so they can get home.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No way! You can’t be running around New York alone. You're too little.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: I'm big to them.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Then, I’m coming too. Wait for me at the subway.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: No, you’re not!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Okay, okay! Shhhh! The front door slams as Gracie gets in. Sam and Sophie fa smiles at Gracie as backs them out of the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie waves innocently as Gracie & Sam drive off. Sam gi her a warning finger: “don’t you leave without me!” Sophi sticks out a resentful tongue as TINY, WIDE-OPEN EYES pee from her backpack pouches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick cruises down the aisle as items fly off shelves o both sides, filling the cart. We catch only a glimpse of tiny blue “shoppers” working the shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GANG BANGERS do pull-ups, etc. Gargamel, holding Azrael a his bag, watches the sky. He turns to see BUBBA, a huge c with a phonebook-sized Sudoku book, towering over him.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: Do you mind? I’ve summoned the giant eagles to fetch me out of here and you're blocking my view.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 64.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBA
dialogues.text: (re his Sudoku) Doh. This box could be a six or two or this box could be a six or two.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: Look, you fat-necked circus freak, I’m expected at GlamourCon. I am Lady Laurent’s star presenter.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBA
dialogues.text: Excuse me while I rip your legs off. Bubba GROWLS and CRACKS his knuckles. Just then, the moth returns leading... AN EPIC SWARM of FLIES.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: No no! I said, eagles not flies. Gargamel is blackened entirely by flies and lifted slowly the ground, holding Azrael and his bag. GARGAMEL (CONT’D) (spitting out flies) Oh, very well... Up! Up, you inglorious devils! Laboring under Gargamel’s weight, the flies smash him int top of a chin-up bar’s upright pole, groin-first. GARGAMEL (CONT’D) (pained falcetto) Owwwwww! I’m coming, m’lady! He WAILS in pain as the flies drag him, ass-first, throug barbed-wire fence top and away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rays of sun pierce the dusty dimness as the door creaks o

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hello? Sophie and Sam wander through silk kites, jars of dried h and a life-like display of an OLD CHINESE MAN in Ray-Bans sitting for ceremonial tea.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (unzipping the Smurfs) Alright, find your book... But I’m watching you. Papa and the others scramble from the backpacks.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 65.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sam. Smurf out, everyone. Suddenly, the Chinese Man “mannequin” grabs Sam’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE MAN
dialogues.text: Ahhh, little blue folk, you bring. The kids freeze.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No worries. Stranger things I have seen. What is it you seek?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Heaven’s to Smurfatroid! It’s here! The old man shuffles to join the others at the back of th store, where Papa holds a book among stacks of ancient te

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE MAN
dialogues.text: Ah, many have sought to the secrets of this volume. But none could pay the price. Read it, you can? CLOSE ON BOOK: A dusty original, “What Do Smurfs Do All D A familiar symbol glitters beneath the title... PEYO. Pap turns the book over and struggles to read... Backwards.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: E smurfineus rei magnificum flibertygibbet Ahnk... The book begins to GLOW as various spells, illustrated by ENGRAVINGS, COME TO LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFS
dialogues.text: Ooooh.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Let’s see... Lightening Strikes, Tornado, Hail... Ah, here we are... Moon. Blood Red, Eclipse... Blue. ANGLE ON the HOLOGRAPHIC “pop up book.” A BLUE MOON crest over FOG as a shimmering PORTAL, like at the Forbidden Gr rises up from a misty POND. The Smurfs are awed.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is the cost of this book?

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE MAN
dialogues.text: For you? One day only... Twenty thousand. Cash.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 66. Papa Gulps. The Smurfs Gulp. Sophie looks to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’ve got eleven dollars.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Might we please just copy this spell?

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE MAN
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Fine... that would be. As he thrusts out a hand for Sam’s cash, Papa hurriedly scribbles from the book.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: In the full moon’s glow, stir in slowly, the feather of a bird that does not fly. Finely ground powder of a unicorn’s horn... Hair of a... As Sam and Sophie share a worried look we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gargamel DROPS FROM THE SKY. Azrael SPLASHES down beside Plucking off a few SNAPPING TURTLES, they charge back int Belvedere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cook works up a smurfy mess in the kitchen as Romeo direc Tailor and a few others in a pandemonium of preparations. Patrick tastes a simple familiar treat of his own...

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Huh... I may survive this yet. Gracie’s going to love these.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE
dialogues.text: (tasting) Smurflicious! What do you call it?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: S'mores. I made these on a hot plate when we were in college.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE
dialogues.text: (giggling) S’more please! Patrick’s phone RINGS. Patrick answer without thinking?  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 67.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van hustles through the uber-trendy lobby, talking on an outdated rent-a-phone. GlamourCon will soon be in full sw

dialogues.speaker: VAN
dialogues.text: You took a personal day? During Glamourcon? Have you lost your mind?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Well, we get two a year and--

dialogues.speaker: VAN
dialogues.text: Patrick, Odile’s unveiling a new discovery today and she needs you in the office on PR, STAT. The line goes dead. Patrick slumps.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE
dialogues.text: Mr. Winslow, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: All she wanted was a simple romantic dinner. I'’11 be lucky if I’m back in time to make Fruit Loops... Je suis mort quand je lui dis de Paris. (SUBTITLE: I am dead when I tell her of Paris.) Where’s Papa? The Smurfs nervous looks only add to Patrick alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie, Clumsy and Sam gape, slack-jawed, into the tank.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: They couldn’t pick the feather of a bird that can’t fly or fight? IN THE TANK: Gutsy, Hefty and Papa are in a Keystone Cops brawl with a huddle of angry, wing-slapping, PENGUINS.

dialogues.speaker: GUTSY
dialogues.text: It's one featherrr! Git ooover it!  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 68.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: (covers her/Clumsy’s eyes) We shouldn’t be exposed to such violence. Gutsy flees with a FEATHER and the now tattered, soggy, l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gargamel kicks the holy crap out of his lab gear, despera trying to squeeze from it some last residue of potion.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: C’mon, blast you! I know there’s a drop in there somewhere! He pounds the table so hard that Azrael is bounced up int rafters where he clings upsidedown, WAILING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie and Sam keep watch as Gutsy and Hefty file the hor from the skeleton of a prehistoric RHINO.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: He doesn’t look like a unicorn.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Well, technically, any one-horned beast in a storm. The head CRASHES to the floor. Hefty pops out from behind

dialogues.speaker: HEFTY
dialogues.text: Uh... I could put that back on. The kids toss the Smurfs into Sophie’s buggy and flee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids get odd looks as Sophie pushes her stroller nonchalantly through a forest of hulking body builders.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: (squinting at fading list) “Hair of a giant.” These guys count?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: (peering from stroller) Oh, they count all right.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 69. Suddenly PATRICK EWING is towering over them. The kids an Smurfs watch, amazed, as he crosses to a bench press. Instantly, Hefty and Gutsy slink down from the stroller a stealthily head for Mr. Ewing with a small SCISSORS. Over dumbbells, through slamming machinery, they get to the be Straining under the weight, Mr. Ewing’s eyes go wide as,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie and Sam sprint away with the Smurf-buggy. Patrick Ewing leans from the door, missing a swath of hair.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK EWING
dialogues.text: Next time just ask for an autograph! Sophie and Sam race across the street. As they do, a car SCREECHES to a stop, inches from them. It’s... Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids and Smurfs sit anxiously as Patrick deals with P

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I don’t believe this. I trusted you. “One Papa to another?” Then you run off with my kids?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Dad, we're okay!

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: That’s not the point. (to Papa) If you needed a book so badly, why didn’t you just say so?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Master Winslow, I tried, but--

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Oh, I see, the truth’s not so easy when it’s on the other foot, eh?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: I'm smurfly sorry, Master Winslow. I’m just so smurfed about getting my little Smurfs home, I guess I just let fear get the smurf of me.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 70.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Stop it! You can’t just say smurf to mean whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: GUTSY
dialogues.text: He smurrfs a good point, Pappy. I'’11 smurrrf him that.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: No! That's what I mean. Smurfity- smurf, smurf smurf! The mortified Smurfs cover their ears in shock.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Mr. Winslow. The children.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Get in the car. All of you. (to kids) I'm dropping you at Aunt Gail's... (to Smurfs) And you, back to the house for the rest of your little blue horde, then I want you all back to mushroom town or wherever it is you came from. Patrick holds the car door open. Papa doesn’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: You have every right to be angry, but we can't go home until we finish collecting our ingredients, then recopy our spell at Master Li’s.

dialogues.speaker: GUTSY
dialogues.text: (re soggy/torn notes) ‘Ad a little roon-in wit a black'n’ white demon, we did.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: They’1l never make it back to our house on those stubby little legs. And they’ve got to work the spell before the full moon sets.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: What are you all talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Can’t you pick them up after work? They're a family. He’s their Papa. (from experience) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 71.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you know how hard it is when your Papa’s not there and you need him? Patrick gazes helplessly into the pleading eyes of his ki

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Fine. I'11 pick them up at the bookstore after work. Patrick’s unsure whether to be annoyed or touched as Soph hugs Clumsy, then reluctantly gets in the car. It’s a pai goodbye as the car pulls away, leaving the Smurfs behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having all but destroyed his lab, Gargamel desperately st with a candle into his last piece of tubing.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: Blast it! I command you, come out! Suddenly great bolt of blue energy shoots from the tubing blowing a hole through the back wall. Gargamel stares at tube, amazed, then lovingly coaxes a few last drops of re into his vial. He smiles at an amazed Azrael... GARGAMEL (CONT’D) You don’t suppose that will come in handy, do you? They toss back their heads in a hearty PIRATE LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smurfs spread rose petals as Romeo peers out the window.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: Here she comes! Stations everyone! Smurfs scramble to their places as if staffing a resort.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE
dialogues.text: I sure hope this is what Mr. Winslow had in mind.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Trust me. She'll love it.

dialogues.speaker: VANITY
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Why do you think they call me Romeo?  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 72.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: Actually... none of us really knows. As Romeo ponders this truth, Gracie enters and is amazed. GRACIE’S POV: The house has been transformed -- candles g the perfect lighting, rose petals drop from above.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: Wow... Patrick? Honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracie enters to find, not Patrick, but Cook and his team

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: Where’s Patrick?

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: (bad at lying) Uh... hiding? Unfortunately, all the Smurfs are bad at lying...

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: Yes! Exactly. You can come out now, Mr. Winslow. (to Gracie) Surprise!

dialogues.speaker: SMURFS
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! Surpriiiiiise!

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE
dialogues.text: (after a long silence) Um, actually he just stepped out for a minute to um... Pick you flowers.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFS
dialogues.text: Yes! That’s it! Flowers! Beautiful, smurfy, romantic flowers! Gracie stares them all down.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: (lamely) He made all this. I’m just stirring.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE
dialogues.text: (breaking down) Aw, it’s no good! I’m sorry, Mrs. Winslow. He had to go to work and we just couldn’t bear to see you sad.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 73. Gracie’s eyes water up.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: But he insists the lady enjoy a smurfy merlot while she waits. Romeo holds a glass. Gracie grabs the bottle and exits, leaving the Smurfs miserable.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: That went well, eh? INT. THE GANSEVOORT - HOTEL —- LATE AFTERNOON - SAME GLITTERATI mingle to house music mix. A FANFARE and SPOTL bring us to Odile, striding down a runway.

dialogues.speaker: ODILE
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentleman, and now the moment you’ve all been waiting for... Laurent International presents... Monsieur Gargamel. A curtain swooshes open. Gargamel and Azrael blink into t SPOTLIGHT as two STUNNING MODELS slip a new Armani HAIR R onto each of them, like a rock stars. Odile takes Gargamel’s hand and the three of them stride runway to the MUSIC. Pausing at WOMAN VOLUNTEER (50's), t pull her up to the runway. Gargamel theatrically opens hi vial and pours a drop of potion onto her head. In SHIMMER OF MAGIC, the woman TRANSFORMS into a gorgeous year-old version of herself. Her image fills the BIG SCRE

dialogues.speaker: ODILE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mes amis! The Rasputin of the Beauty Révolution!... The the crowd goes INSANE. As much as Gargamel was mocked the opening... Now, he is adored.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: (to Azrael) Ha! Tony Robbins-Hood can kiss my big hairy Azrael! Eh, kitty? Ha! As they LAUGH, Azrael and Gargamel are swept onto the dan floor and launch into a manic, medieval ROMP. The crowd j in for... A Slumdog, JAI HO-like dance extravaganza.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few TOURISTS stroll the sidewalk, oblivious to the over turned dog food box, paper bag, and jumbo take-out carton stumbling along, powered by little blue feet. A ROTTWEILER on a leash, BARKS, startling the Smurfs. The tumble down the stairs of a lower level apartment. IN THE STAIRWELL: Papa, Gutsy, Hefty and Clumsy shake off their disguises. Papa wrestles with the unwieldy map.

dialogues.speaker: HEFTY
dialogues.text: Are we almost there? I’m starving.

dialogues.speaker: GUTSY
dialogues.text: Yurrr noot the only one weak in the knees. He indicates Clumsy, who begins to COUGH. He’s very pale.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Clumsy, are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: CLUMSY
dialogues.text: (clearly not) I'b fime. Let's kleep Smurfin’.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Maybe we should have our Smurfberry rations. It’s been too long. The Smurfs reach into Papa’s pouch and savor their portio

dialogues.speaker: CLUMSY
dialogues.text: (overstating) Mmmm, burfsmerries... Buch metter.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: (re the pouch) That’s odd. There’s extra. In their hunger, Hefty and Gutsy gobble the last few.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Either I packed too many... or someone's not taking their rations. (off their blinking eyes) Show me your hands. The Smurfs open their hands. Each is stained with berry juice... except Clumsy.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 75.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (stunned) Oh, Clumsy... you haven’t been taking your Smurfberries, have you? Ashamed, frightened, Clumsy shakes his head, “No.”

dialogues.speaker: PAPA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No wonder you’re so pale!

dialogues.speaker: CLUMSY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Papa. This whole thing’s my fault, so I just had to be sure you'd all make it home.

dialogues.speaker: HEFTY
dialogues.text: (eyes watering up) So... you’ve been giving us your share?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Alright, there’s no time to lose. We have to get that spell and get Clumsy home to our village tonight or he's Smurfed. (re empty berry pouch) And the rest of us aren’t far behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracie, channel surfs in search of... anything. Her phone BUZZES. It’s Patrick. She hits IGNORE and tosses it onto side table, knocking over an old Diet Coke. Annoyed, Gracie gets up to blot the spill, but as she doe uncovers the PARIS FILE. The airline ticket sleeve is unmistakable... as is her look of broken-hearted betrayal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Champagne flows. Gargamel holds court with a bevy of stun MODELS. All are fit with custom Armani HAIR ROBES.

dialogues.speaker: MODEL
dialogues.text: Oh, do me next! I want some! Please, Gargie! Me too!

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: Now, ladies, let’s not beg. On second thought, do beg.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 76. GARGAMEL basks in the crowd’s approval, near tears. He’s popular, he’s beloved, he’s a god. Odile pulls close.

dialogues.speaker: ODILE
dialogues.text: Well, it looks like you and I are going to rule the world.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: My mother would be so proud... If I had one.

dialogues.speaker: ODILE
dialogues.text: (fondling his vile) All we need now are truckloads of this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: (nervously) Oh. Right. Actually... I believe you can help me with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gathered upon the table, the Smurfs dine on the feast mea for Patrick and Gracie.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE
dialogues.text: Poor Mrs. W. I never dreamed a man could be gone this long.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: Well, lucky for us, I’m sure Papa will be back soon.

dialogues.speaker: HANDY
dialogues.text: (toasting) To Papa!

dialogues.speaker: GROUCHY
dialogues.text: To going home!

dialogues.speaker: SMURFS
dialogues.text: To going home! Spirits back up, the Smurfs dig in. It’s a rich family sc especially for Gracie, who watches for a beat, unnoticed the archway as the guys jostle to serve Smurfette.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS SMURFS
dialogues.text: (comically polite) Please pass the greens... Allow me, Smurfette. No, allow me, Smurfette. No, allow me... Peas, please. Your hearts of palm? Smurflicious!  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 77.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE
dialogues.text: (spotting Gracie) Oh, Mrs. W. Won’t you join us?

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: I’m sure you man will be home any minute.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: (sits, then, sadly) I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finishing up work, Patrick pulls on his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Gracie, good news, I'll be home in twenty. And I’1l make all this up to you. Promise. A BUZZ on his INTERCOM.

dialogues.speaker: ODILE
dialogues.text: Patrick, Dahling, my office, S'il vous plait? Patrick SIGHS at yet one more thing... INT. ODILE’S OFFICE - NIGHT Patrick enters to find Odile seated behind her elegant de

dialogues.speaker: ODILE
dialogues.text: Darling, this this is Monsieur Gargamel. He believes you have something of his. Gargamel sprawls on the couch, playing with Van’s phone.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: Charmed, I’m sure. Gargamel smiles his least sleazy smile, and SNAPS Patrick picture as Azreal PURRS, rubbing against Patrick’s leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wining, dining, Gracie and Smurfs. Laughing, tipsy, but.. for the first time all day, Gracie is at peace. Farmer of a slice of BLUE TOMATO. Gracie savors it.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 78.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: Mmmm, Farmer. What'd you call this?

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: Fried blue tomatoes.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you guys do this every night.

dialogues.speaker: SMURFETTE
dialogues.text: We can’t believe you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: Yes, but they do have Google. Gracie smiles. Her table is brimming with warmth as Smurf share bread, CLINKING glasses and LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: You guys have no idea how special what you have is... Gracie sips her wine, tinged with warmth and sadness.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I do... Gracie and the Smurfs look up to see Patrick. Gracie gets and takes her plate to the sink, her back to Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gracie... I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: About dinner?... Or Paris? She reveals his Paris file on the counter. Sensing the tension, the Smurfs quietly slip away.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Gracie... we need this promotion. I'm barely keeping our heads above water as it is.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: And you think being away from us even more is the answer?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: No! But what are we going to do, Gracie? Fix the kids teeth ourselves? Sell the dog? Maybe go live in a mushroom?  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 79.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: Patrick, if money is the problem, tell me. We can cut back. (re their lifestyle) Is all this really worth it?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Riiight. Sure. These little blue guys have taken over your brain, haven't they?

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: (beat, stung) Did you hear me? Did you hear a word I said? They stop as the kids come in, but the tension is obvious

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Uh... we’re home.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: (hugs Sophie) Hi, guys.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Where’s Papa and the others?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Oh, actually, that’s one good thing. I met their owner. He’s picking up Papa and I said I'd bring the rest by tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: What? You promised you’d get ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: (concerned) This owner, didn’t have a huge, nasty- looking cat, did he?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: (off Patrick’s look) Dad! How could you?! I trusted you! Papa trusted you!

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: What? What’d I do?  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 80.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (urgently) Mom, you gotta take us to China Town. Papa’s in trouble, we’ve got to move! The kids pull her toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: What are talking about? What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I'll explain on the way.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: You promised, Daddy! I told you it was important. I thought you were listening.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I was. I just--

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’ll get the keys! Sophie scurries after Sam. Upset by her distraught kids, Gracie turns to Patric.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I... I don’t know. As Gracie starts for the door...

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He did what? The Smurfs burst into tears 0.S. with Sophie. Gracie free then turns back to Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: You know what? Maybe you should just take Paris. You’re already so far away... What’s the difference? She hurries after her kids. Patrick stares after, pained.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gathered around the open book, the Smurfs listen as Papa WHISPERS the spell to Hefty, who copies it like a scribe. old Chinese man is asleep in the B.G.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: “,..then mix the ingredients and smurf the holy words.” You got the holy words, right?

dialogues.speaker: HEFTY
dialogues.text: (as he writes) Good as done. PLOP! Clumsy passes out face down on the writing, then po back up, acting in vain as if nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: CLUMSY
dialogues.text: (delirious) I’m goob! Better felt never!

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Good Lord, he’s getting worse. Headlights FLASH in the window as a car pulls up outside.

dialogues.speaker: HEFTY
dialogues.text: Thank Smurf! There’s Mr. Patrick. The door CREAKS open and in steps... Gargamel.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: Hello, old friends. As the Smurfs back away in dread, Gargamel delights in a display of CHINESE BLADES. The Chinese starts from his sl

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE MAN
dialogues.text: W-who are you?

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) Ooooo, enter the dragon... Gargamel grabs a dragon-handled, ivory letter-opener. GARGAMEL (CONT’D) Poor little lizard, looks thirsty. He pours a DROP OF ESSENCE into the dragon’s mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE MAN
dialogues.text: Look, can I help you?  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 82.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: (invoking a spell)

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON FIRE
dialogues.text: The handle’s dragon eyes GLOW RED. BLUE ENERGY spits from mouth, engulfing the sheath in CRACKLING electrical magic

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE MAN
dialogues.text: Alright, I’m calling the-- ZZZAM! Gargamel unleashes a bolt of BLUE ENERGY from his magic “scepter.” The Smurfs SCREAM as Chinese man is FROZ in a web of CRACKLING blue energy.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Run! The Smurfs flee through a beaded curtain into the back ro Bringing up the rear, Papa pauses in archway to fend off Azrael just as... Gargamel LAUGHS and fires another MAGIC BOLT from his sce Papa grabs a souvenir mirror and, bracing himself, deflec the energy away from his Smurfs, bouncing it wildly aroun store. Books and shelves fly. Azrael YOWLS for cover.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL

dialogues.text: Thank you, Daddy! Thank you! Papa, surrounded by his own adoring “kids” steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Yes. A hundred thanks.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: You were right... Hands to help. The two fathers share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are we going home? Or What? Everyone turns to see Brainy standing proudly on a log.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I didn’t listen, Papa, but a Smurf’s gotta do, what a Smurf’s gotta do.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Brainy, I’m proud of you. But you're right. We better get home while we can. Is everbody here?

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: All but one. (into phone) Blue leader to Blue Bird. Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gutsy works the joystick on his belly with one hand and clutches Gargamel’s heavy scepter with the other. It’s ro flying. Following below, Gargamel PANTS for breath.

dialogues.speaker: GUTSY
dialogues.text: (taunting) ‘At's it, ya little girrrly wizard! Who’s the bully now, eh? eh?

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: (winded, but smiling) Remember, little one... Pride goeth before the fall.

dialogues.speaker: GUTSY
dialogues.text: What arrre ye talkin’ aboot? It's oover for ye, ya' crrrazy loon.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 100. Gutsy doesn’t see Azrael slinking up a tree, behind him. Suddenly... MEOWLLLLL! Azrael leaps from a branch and swa the copter before crashing into a bush.

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL GUTSY
dialogues.text: Gooooooed kitty! Aaaaaaaaaaaaagh! Gutsy, drops the wand and spins out of control, disappear into the trees. ON GARGAMEL: IN SLOW MO, he makes a diving leap for the w as it tumbles toward an open subway vent. Horses SCREAM as a late-night CARRIAGE stops just short o trampling Gargamel. He stands, fire in his eyes... the scepter in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the thicket by the pond Hefty struggles alone to add ingredients to the boiling pot.

dialogues.speaker: HEFTY
dialogues.text: (reading) Hair of a Giant... Feather of a flightless bird... The Winslows, Papa and the Smurfs charge onto the scene.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Hefty! Time to go!

dialogues.speaker: HEFTY
dialogues.text: Already, Papa! Sophie and Smurfette rush in with Grouchy and Reina. Ever gathers around the pot as thick BLUE FOG spews from the b

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: (unfurling the spell) Brainy... Do the honors?... You earned it. Brainy proudly, but humbly, takes the scroll and reads...

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: Unimoonibus... Bluticus... Yarayak.... Kahol... WHOOSH! A mighty WIND blasts through the park, spreading thick FOG. Veiled in the fog, a huge MOON appears to rise its glow, distinctively BLUE. The Winslows’ jaws drop.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 101.

dialogues.speaker: HEFTY
dialogues.text: Look! The pond waters being to roil. As in the Forbidden Grotto glistening rock formation rises up. A SHIMMERING PORTAL blazes behind the falling waters. A rocky path emerges, leading to shore. Suddenly, a horse-drawn carriage charges up in the distan

dialogues.speaker: GARGAMEL
dialogues.text: Ya! YAAAAAA!

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Lesser known Smurfs charge across the watery path and div through the portal with hardly time to wave goodbye. The carriage bears down with terrifying speed with Gargam standing beside Azrael, whipping the horses like Ben Hur. Panicked smurfs cross into the portal as fast as they can Gargamel aims his scepter... ZAP! A bolt of blue energy OBLITERATES THE PORTAL, trapping Papa and half the smurfs our world while the other half are trapped in theirs. Gargamel aims again, this time directly at Papa and the remaining Smurfs. As they SCREAM and scramble for cover, hear the familiar whir of SPUTTERING ROTORS...

dialogues.speaker: GUTSY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Pick on someone yer oon size, ya’ smurrrfin' wanker! Gutsy has risen and is diving for Gargamel.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Gutsy, noooooo! BAM! Gutsy kamikazees into Gargamel's head. The copter disintegrates, hurling Gutsy onto the horses face. Gargam falls back in the carriage, missing his shot. IN SLOW MO: the wand flies through the air... little blue hands dive for it. It falls to... CLUMSY. He grabs... He bobbles... collapses... drops the wand into the murky pon

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE/PAPA
dialogues.text: Clumsy! They run to help him.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 102.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: Gutsy! All eyes turn to see the runaway horse, freaked by the bl creature clinging to it’s face, rear up at the WALL of th 79TH STREET TRANSVERSE. Gargamel, Azrael and Gutsy are th over the wall, toward the speeding traffic below.

dialogues.speaker: GUTSY
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaaaaagh! Yeeeeeeeeeoow!l ! WHAP! Gargamel and Azrael are comically flattened on the windshield of a passing bus. It carries them away, with B ad wrap celebrating: JET BLUE TO BELGIUM FROM $299! Winslows and Smurfs are shocked at Gutsy’s sacrifice. The

dialogues.speaker: GUTSY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, doon jus’ stand thar! Give a Smurrrf a hand! A tiny blue hand reaches over from the wall... Gutsy’s clinging safely above the speeding traffic. The Smurfs CH as Sam, Hefty and others rush to pull him to safety. Angle on Papa and Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (re destroyed Portal) What are you going to do? Papa looks up at the moon as the fog clears away... It’s clearly no longer blue.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: I don’t know... I really don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: HEFTY
dialogues.text: Hey... Look. An inky BLUE spreads from where the wand went in. The reflection of the moon is also blue, but the real moon is still only white. Clumsy, lies weak on the shore, his head in Sophie’s lap.

dialogues.speaker: CLUMSY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry guys... I-- blew it again. Spent and pale, Clumsy’s hand drops into the water.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Clumsy?  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 103.

dialogues.speaker: CLUMSY
dialogues.text: I just wish... the moon was really blue... and you all could go home. Triggered at Clumsy’s hand in the water, the magic blue essence shimmers on the water. BLUE ENERGY arcs over the surface of the pond, dancing on the reflection of the moo Then, it rises up toward the Moon itself.

dialogues.speaker: GUTSY
dialogues.text: Grrreat Smurf! Everyone looks up to see the Moon actually turning BLUE. Clumsy’s eyes open as the color begins to return to his h then spreads to his whole body.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Great Smurf, indeed! Clumsy! You've done it! Clumsy sits up, renewed as the portal begins to rise from water again. The Smurfs stare in awe as the rocky path re emerges to bear them home. QUICK SHOTS ALL OVER NEW YORK: NIGHT-LIFERS and WILDLIFE to gaze up in amazement at the BLUE MOON. IN THE PARK: Smurfs eagerly line up to walk the shimmerin stone path to the portal, where Brainy directs them throu Each returns to their deep blue as they dive in.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: Come along everyone. No telling how long the spell will last. Hefty approaches the portal, then turns and waves to the Winslows.

dialogues.speaker: HEFTY
dialogues.text: Good bye! We’ll never forget you! As the Winslows wave back, Hefty reaches out a tentative hand... WHOOSH! He’s sucked through before he knows what happened. A line of others wave goodbye and follow. Gutsy, Jokey and Vanity and Romeo get in line.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: (to Gracie and Patrick) Know how often I’ve see love like yours? (off their looks) Once in a Blue Moon.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 104. Patrick takes Gracie’s hand. She pulls in close.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: We'll never be able to repay you for all your kindness...and bravery.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: You've already repaid me. (squeezing Gracie’s hand) More than you'll ever know. Gracie smiles and takes Patrick’s arm. He puts an arm aro his family as they gather close around Papa and Clumsy.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: If you work together, and truly treasure each other, everything will be smurfy, indeed.

dialogues.speaker: REINA
dialogues.text: Smurf. Everyone turns, LAUGHING, as Reina holds Grouchy one last and utters her first words.

dialogues.speaker: REINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: B-bye.

dialogues.speaker: WINSLOWS
dialogues.text: She's talking! Way to go Reina! Good job, sweetie! (etc.).

dialogues.speaker: GROUCHY
dialogues.text: (trying to hide his tears) I hate “b-bye’s”... But I love you. Sophie kneels down to Clumsy. Her eyes are also welling u

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Will I ever see you again?

dialogues.speaker: CLUMSY
dialogues.text: Papa?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: Keep an eye out for each other... every blue moon. Papa’s eyes TWINKLE as Sophie and Clumsy fall into a hug.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Say it’s not just a dream.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 105.

dialogues.speaker: CLUMSY
dialogues.text: You're not dreaming, Sophie. I am your friend.

dialogues.speaker: BRAINY
dialogues.text: Papa! Clumsy! The spell! Sure enough the BLUE ENERGY is FADING. The Winslows share last hug with Papa and Clumsy, then watch tearfully as th join Brainy and Smurfette at the Portal.

dialogues.speaker: WINSLOWS
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: CLUMSY /BRAINY /PAPA/SMURFETTE
dialogues.text: Auf-Wiedersmurf! Brainy waves and goes in. Papa waves, takes Clumsy’s hand steps in. Clumsy locks teary eyes with Sophie... and he’s gone. The Winslows watch from shore as the BLUE ENERGY FA and the Portal sinks back down. But the moon... stays Blu

dialogues.speaker: END CREDITS
dialogues.text: The Smurfs return to their village, SINGING. Reprising th dance number from the opening, this time, they get it rig MORE END CREDITS. Then... Patrick sadly packs the personal effects of his office in boxes as he prepares to look for work. Odile enters.

dialogues.speaker: ODILE
dialogues.text: What on earth are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I'm... fired. No?

dialogues.speaker: ODILE
dialogues.text: You silly, stupid, big strong man. Do you know the last time anyone stood up to me the way you did? (off Patrick’s confusion) You have what it takes to handle the sharks in this office. Up til now, there was only me. If you manage New York... I’m free to take to Paris. She gratefully kisses his cheek and exits blissfully.  THE SMURFS - Stem & Weiss - 6/16/09 106.

dialogues.speaker: ODILE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Salut, Paris. Ici je viens! Patrick watches her go... dumbstruck. MORE CREDITS. Then... The Winslows frolic in Central Park. Patrick and Sam fly helicopter.
